roleset.name: make a booming noise
roleset.note: BOOM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'boom' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from boom.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: ergative
example.text: Lights flickered on and off; plaster dropped from the ceiling, the walls still shook and an evacuation alarm boomed outside.

example.name: transitive
example.text: John boomed his stereo from the rooftops.

roleset.name: be successful, growing suddenly and quickly
roleset.note: BOOM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'boom' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from boom.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: boom times
example.text: MUTUAL FUNDS ARRIVED IN THE U.S. during the Roaring Twenties they had been in Britain for a century, but they didn't boom until the money market fund was created in the 1970s.
example.arg: until the money market fund was created in the 1970s

roleset.name: produce loudly
roleset.note: BOOM_OUT-V NOTES: This is really weird usage. (from boom.03-v)

example.name: yes, this actually appeared in WSJ
example.text: If a strike ever hits the Met, the company can still sell tickets to his ``Boheme'' and ``Turandot'' and boom out recordings (of another era).
example.arg: If a strike ever hits the Met
